channel.title: Iterating in a Template :: Java Web Development
channel.description:
Letâ€™s revisit part of the non-efficient HTML from the introduction, where we hard-coded coffee options in a list.
  1. French Roast
  2. Espresso
  3. Kopi Luwak
  4. Instant
If we want to add, remove, or edit the list items, we need to go in and change the individual tags, which is a poor use of our time. Fortunately, there is a way to streamline the process. In Java, we use for/each loops to iterate through the items in a data collection.
